meanings.definition: A person who carries out a task or duty
meanings.sent1: The executers of the project worked diligently to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The executers in the office ensure that all tasks are completed efficiently.
meanings.sent3: The executers at the party were the ones responsible for organizing the games.
meanings.sent4: She was the executers of change, always taking charge and making things happen.
meanings.sent5: The executers of the plan were praised for their hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: A device or program that performs a specific function
meanings.sent1: The new smartphone comes with advanced executers for better performance.
meanings.sent2: The executers in the factory are responsible for automating the production line.
meanings.sent3: The executers in the kitchen made cooking dinner a breeze.
meanings.sent4: The robot vacuum cleaner is an efficient executers for keeping the house clean.
meanings.sent5: The executers in the computer system ensure smooth operation of the software.

meanings.definition: A legal document authorizing someone to carry out the terms of a will
meanings.sent1: The lawyer presented the executers of the will to the family for approval.
meanings.sent2: The executers of the estate followed the instructions in the legal document carefully.
meanings.sent3: The executers of the will were surprised by the unexpected bequest.
meanings.sent4: She entrusted the executers with the responsibility of distributing her assets.
meanings.sent5: The executers of the will ensured that the deceased's wishes were fulfilled.
